title: Make Your Website Load Faster with Cache
subtitle: Improve your website's speed and visitor experience by managing the cache. It's simple, and no technical skills are needed.

refresh.title: Clear Website Cache
refresh.description: Clear your website's cache to make sure everyone sees the latest version of your site right away. Your site might be a little slower for a moment while it rebuilds, but it's usually very quick.

confirm.title: Clear Website Cache?
confirm.description: This will clear all the temporary files that help your website load quickly. Your website might be slightly slower temporarily as it creates new ones.
confirm.warning: Heads up: Your website might load a bit slower right after clearing the cache.

info.title: What is Website Cache and Why Does it Matter?
info.description: Think of cache like a shortcut for your website visitors. It saves temporary copies of your website's files so that returning visitors can load your site much faster. Clearing the cache is like hitting a refresh button, useful after you make updates so visitors see the changes.
benefits: Faster loading times for your visitors
Your website feels snappier and more responsive
Happier visitors who stay on your site longer
Can even help a little with how search engines see your site (they like fast sites!)

issues.title: Potential Issues After Clearing Cache
issues.description: Sometimes, after clearing the cache, you or your visitors might notice a few minor things. Don't worry, these are usually temporary and resolve themselves quickly as the cache rebuilds.
items: Your website might load slightly slower for the first few visitors
Some elements might appear slightly different until the cache is fully rebuilt
In rare cases, you might need to log in to certain areas of your website again
